repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body: ## Problem: When using 'diffopt=inline:word', lines were excessively fragmented with punctuation creating separate highlight blocks, making it harder to read the diffs. ## Solution: This PR add a new `mergeblocks` option for `'diffopt'`. Which when enabled alongside `inline:word`, this merges adjacent diff blocks separated by small gaps (‚â§2 bytes) of whitespace or punctuation **when the combined change size is significant**. - This creates more readable diffs and closely matches GitHub's own diff display. https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/10bcedae-a706-4993-918d-ecb441f9d696 ## Backwards Compatibility - The new behavior is **opt-in**: only enabled if `'mergeblocks'` is set in `'diffopt'`. - Default behavior for `'inline:word'` is unchanged, preserving backward compatibility. ## Usage Enable with: ``` :set diffopt+=inline:word,mergeblocks ``` ## Implementation - Adds a `DIFF_MERGE_BLOCKS` flag and **diff_refine_inline_word_highlight()** implementation in C to merge word fragments separated by punctuation or whitespace (‚â§2 bytes). - Option parsing, docs, and completion support included. ## Tests - Added/updated functional tests to cover: - Old and new behaviors (with and without `mergeblocks`) - Edge cases: multi-byte, iwhite, iwhiteeol, punctuation, 3-buffer diffs ## Documentation - Updated `:help diff`, options, and news/changelog/documentation for the new option. This creates more readable and is similar to github diff behaviour with backward compactibility. Fixes #37019

comment_regular_data.body:
So the functional tests failed in tests/functional/ui/diff_spec.lua which is expected as I have changed how the Diff works for `inline:word` in diff.c

But the outputs of the failed tests shows that, the result we got from the tests are working as intended.

Like:
`:set diffopt=internal,filler,inline:word`

```
Expected:
|*{7:  }{27:^abcdef}{4: }{27:ghi}{4: }{27:jk}{4: n }‚îÇ{7:  }{27:aBcef}{4: }{27:gHi}{4: }{27:lm}{4: n  }|
           |---------------------------------|
                     Separated by spaces
```

```
Actual:
|*{7:  }{27:^abcdef ghi jk}{4: n }‚îÇ{7:  }{27:aBcef gHi lm}{4: n  }|
          |-----------------|
        Highlighted Together
```

Another Test :- 

Expected:
```
|*{7:  }{27:^This+is}{4:=}{27:a}{4:-setence      }‚îÇ{7:  }{27:This+is}{4:=}{27:another}{4:-setenc}‚îÇ{7:  }{27:That+is}{4:=}{27:a}{4:-setence     }|

{27:^This+is}{4:=}{27:a} : Separated by '='
```

Actual:
```
|*{7:  }{27:^This+is=a}{4:-setence      }‚îÇ{7:  }{27:This+is=another}{4:-setenc}‚îÇ{7:  }{27:That+is=a}{4:-setence     }|
         |---------------|
            Highlighted
            Together
```

This shows my changes are working as intended and the test should be updated.

Even though I was hesitant to update the test files, but I think this is the most logical way for to implement something like this.

I have updated parts of the test/functional/ui/diff_spec.lua which handles the testing for `inline:word`

1. `set diffopt=internal,filler,inline:word`
Line 2317-2326
Current Test:
```lua
  command('set diffopt=internal,filler diffopt+=inline:word')
  screen:expect([[
    {7:  }{27:^abcdef}{4: }{27:ghi}{4: }{27:jk}{4: n }‚îÇ{7:  }{27:aBcef}{4: }{27:gHi}{4: }{27:lm}{4: n  }|
    {7:  }{22:x               }‚îÇ{7:  }{23:----------------}|
    {7:  }y               ‚îÇ{7:  }y               |
    {7:  }{23:----------------}‚îÇ{7:  }{22:z               }|
    {1:~                 }‚îÇ{1:~                 }|*14
    {3:Xdifile1           }{2:Xdifile2          }|
                                         |
  ]])
```

Test Suggestion From me:
```lua
  command('set diffopt=internal,filler diffopt+=inline:word')
  screen:expect([[
      {7:  }{27:^abcdef ghi jk}{4: n }‚îÇ{7:  }{27:aBcef gHi lm}{4: n  }|
      {7:  }{22:x               }‚îÇ{7:  }{23:----------------}|
      {7:  }y               ‚îÇ{7:  }y               |
      {7:  }{23:----------------}‚îÇ{7:  }{22:z               }|
      {1:~                 }‚îÇ{1:~                 }|*14
      {3:Xdifile1           }{2:Xdifile2          }|
                                           |
    ]])
```

2. `set diffopt=internal,filler,inline:word` with Multi-byte characters
Around Line 2499-2504
Actual Test:
```lua
  command('set diffopt=internal,filler diffopt+=inline:word')
  screen:expect([[
    {7:  }{4:^üöÄ}{27:‚õµÔ∏è}{4:‰∏Ä‰∫å}{27:‰∏â}{4:„Å≤„Çâ}{100:„Åå}{4:„Å™}{27:ŒîŒ≠ŒªœÑŒ±}{4: }{27:Œîelta}{4: fooba}‚îÇ{7:  }{4:üöÄ}{27:üõ∏}{4:‰∏Ä‰∫å}{27:Âõõ}{4:„Å≤„Çâ„Å™}{27:Œ¥Œ≠ŒªœÑŒ±}{4: }{27:Œ¥elta}{4: foobar }|
    {1:~                                    }‚îÇ{1:~                                    }|*17
    {3:Xdifile1                              }{2:Xdifile2                             }|
                                                                               |
  ]])

```

My test suggestion:
```lua
  command('set diffopt=internal,filler diffopt+=inline:word')
  screen:expect([[
      {7:  }{4:^üöÄ}{27:‚õµÔ∏è}{4:‰∏Ä‰∫å}{27:‰∏â}{4:„Å≤„Çâ}{100:„Åå}{4:„Å™}{27:ŒîŒ≠ŒªœÑŒ± Œîelta}{4: fooba}‚îÇ{7:  }{4:üöÄ}{27:üõ∏}{4:‰∏Ä‰∫å}{27:Âõõ}{4:„Å≤„Çâ„Å™}{27:Œ¥Œ≠ŒªœÑŒ± Œ¥elta}{4: foobar }|
      {1:~                                    }‚îÇ{1:~                                    }|*17
      {3:Xdifile1                              }{2:Xdifile2                             }|
                                                                                 |
    ]])

```

3. `set diffopt=internal,filler diffopt+=inline:word,iwhite` 
Around 2574-2583
Original Test:
```lua
  command('set diffopt=internal,filler diffopt+=inline:word,iwhite')
  screen:expect([[
    {7:  }{4:^this   is             }‚îÇ{7:  }{4:this is }{27:some}{4: }{27:test}{4:     }|
    {7:  }{27:sometest}{4: }{27:text}{4: }{27:foo}{4:     }‚îÇ{7:  }{27:texts}{4:                 }|
    {7:  }{27:baz}{4: }{27:abc}{4: }{27:def}{4:           }‚îÇ{7:  }{27:foo}{4: }{27:bar}{4: }{27:abX}{4: }{27:Yef}{4:       }|
    {7:  }{27:one}{4:                   }‚îÇ{7:  }{27:oneword}{4: another word  }|
    {7:  }{27:word}{4: another word     }‚îÇ{7:  }{23:----------------------}|
    {7:  }{22:additional line       }‚îÇ{7:  }{23:----------------------}|
    {1:~                       }‚îÇ{1:~                       }|*12
    {3:Xdifile1                 }{2:Xdifile2                }|
                                                     |
  ]])
```

My Suggestion:
```lua
  command('set diffopt=internal,filler diffopt+=inline:word,iwhite')
  screen:expect([[
    {7:  }{4:^this   is             }‚îÇ{7:  }{4:this is }{27:some test}{4:     }|
    {7:  }{27:sometest text foo}{4:     }‚îÇ{7:  }{27:texts}{4:                 }|
    {7:  }{27:baz abc def}{4:           }‚îÇ{7:  }{27:foo bar abX}{4: }{27:Yef}{4:       }|
    {7:  }{27:one}{4:                   }‚îÇ{7:  }{27:oneword}{4: another word  }|
    {7:  }{27:word}{4: another word     }‚îÇ{7:  }{23:----------------------}|
    {7:  }{22:additional line       }‚îÇ{7:  }{23:----------------------}|
    {1:~                       }‚îÇ{1:~                       }|*12
    {3:Xdifile1                 }{2:Xdifile2                }|
                                                     |
]])
```

4. `set diffopt=internal,filler diffopt+=inline:word,iwhiteeol`
Around 2598-2609

Original Test
```lua
  command('set diffopt=internal,filler diffopt+=inline:word,iwhiteeol')
  screen:expect([[
    {7:  }{4:^this }{100:  }{4:is             }‚îÇ{7:  }{4:this is }{27:some}{4: }{27:test}{4:     }|
    {7:  }{27:sometest}{4: }{27:text}{4: foo     }‚îÇ{7:  }{27:texts}{4:                 }|
    {7:  }{27:baz}{4: }{27:abc}{4: }{27:def}{4:           }‚îÇ{7:  }{4:foo }{27:bar}{4: }{27:abX}{4: }{27:Yef}{4:       }|
    {7:  }{27:one}{4:                   }‚îÇ{7:  }{27:oneword}{4: another word  }|
    {7:  }{27:word}{4: another word     }‚îÇ{7:  }{23:----------------------}|
    {7:  }{22:additional line       }‚îÇ{7:  }{23:----------------------}|
    {1:~                       }‚îÇ{1:~                       }|*12
    {3:Xdifile1                 }{2:Xdifile2                }|
                                                     |
  ]])
```

My Suggestion:
```lua
  command('set diffopt=internal,filler diffopt+=inline:word,iwhiteeol')
  screen:expect([[
    {7:  }{4:^this }{100:  }{4:is             }‚îÇ{7:  }{4:this is }{27:some test}{4:     }|
    {7:  }{27:sometest text}{4: foo     }‚îÇ{7:  }{27:texts}{4:                 }|
    {7:  }{27:baz abc def}{4:           }‚îÇ{7:  }{4:foo }{27:bar abX Yef}{4:       }|
    {7:  }{27:one}{4:                   }‚îÇ{7:  }{27:oneword}{4: another word  }|
    {7:  }{27:word}{4: another word     }‚îÇ{7:  }{23:----------------------}|
    {7:  }{22:additional line       }‚îÇ{7:  }{23:----------------------}|
    {1:~                       }‚îÇ{1:~                       }|*12
    {3:Xdifile1                 }{2:Xdifile2                }|
                                                     |
]])
```

5. 3 Buffer Test:
Around 2767-2772

Original Test:
```lua
  command('set diffopt=internal,filler diffopt+=inline:word')
  local s4 = [[
    {7:  }{27:^This+is}{4:=}{27:a}{4:-setence      }‚îÇ{7:  }{27:This+is}{4:=}{27:another}{4:-setenc}‚îÇ{7:  }{27:That+is}{4:=}{27:a}{4:-setence     }|
    {1:~                        }‚îÇ{1:~                       }‚îÇ{1:~                       }|*17
    {3:Xdifile1                  }{2:Xdifile2                 Xdifile3                }|
                                                                               |
  ]]
```

My Suggestion:
```lua
  command('set diffopt=internal,filler diffopt+=inline:word')
  local s4 = [[
      {7:  }{27:^This+is=a}{4:-setence      }‚îÇ{7:  }{27:This+is=another}{4:-setenc}‚îÇ{7:  }{27:That+is=a}{4:-setence     }|
      {1:~                        }‚îÇ{1:~                       }‚îÇ{1:~                       }|*17
      {3:Xdifile1                  }{2:Xdifile2                 Xdifile3                }|
                                                                                 |
    ]]
```

I hope the context and the tests I have provided are enough to know if my changes make sense. Let me know when I need to make any more changes!

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: feat(diff): adding mergeblocks option in diffopt to reduce inline diff fragmentation for inline:word option
